page.title: 06HOUSING CO-OPERATIVES
page.content: Where I live there are many old houses and flats. People want to move into new houses so some of them get together to form a{housing {co-operative.}They choose a chairman, treasurer and secretary then they start to look around for a piece of unused or derelict land. They approach the{council}and if they agree they lend the co-operative the money for the houses. The people decide what sort of houses they want ie. three bedroom, bungalows, flats, old peoples small houses etc. An{architect}draws the plans. Then a{builder}is chosen and the people move in as each house is completed. The{tenants}pay rent to the co-operative which pays off the debt to the council. The co-operative pays for{maintenance and repairs. There are some co-operatives in our area they make the place look nice.
